clues.text:
Cosmopolitan:
triple sec,
cranberry juice,
lime &
this liquor

Tequila sunrise:
tequila,
grenadine &
this non-alcoholic beverage

Dirty martini:
gin,
dry vermouth &
this liquid

Grasshopper:
creme de cacao,
cream &
this 3-named item

Old fashioned:
sugar, orange,
cherry,
whiskey &
a few drops of these
Bedouin society is patriarchal; families & extended families are led by men with this title
In the 1990s Rwanda was ravaged by the genocide by Hutu militias against this ethnic group
The USA's so-called "5 civilized tribes" were 4 that began with "C" & this southern one that began with "S"
The country due southwest of Uzbekistan is named for these "men"
Historically reindeer herders in this group were free to move across Scandinavian borders
This celebutante starred in & was the exec producer of "The Hottie & the Nottie"
In the mid-1980s she had 7 consecutive No. 1 hits, starting with "Saving All My Love For You"
It wasn't until she was in her 20s that this red-headed actress watched her dad on "Happy Days"
This daughter of an Alaska governor is named for the Connecticut city that's home to ESPN
This Oscar winner directed "The Firm", "Out of Africa" & "Tootsie", in which he also acted
On July 26 president Truman officially desegregated this by executive order
At a Feb. 7 ceremony at the Pentagon, Omar Bradley succeeded this man as U.S. Army Chief of Staff
John Huston directed Bogey in this 1948 film about gold & greed south of the border
April 19 saw this nationalist Chinese leader re-elected to the presidency despite his saying he didn't want the job anymore
At HUAC, Whittaker Chambers' Aug. 3 testimony named 9 ex-govt. officials, including this man who'd advised FDR at Yalta
In "Lysistrata" by Aristophanes, women of Greece withhold their favors to force a peace between these 2 cities
The "Orchestra" section in Greek drama was the circular dancing place of this commenting group
In Euripides' play, Medea gets revenge on this errant husband by killing his new love Glauce with poisoned garments
The prototypical open-air performance space of ancient Greece is called "the Theater of" this fertility god
Aeschylus won victory in a drama tournament in 458 B.C. with this trilogy that includes "Agamemnon"
Life is a circus for Pulex irritans, one of these wingless, bloodsucking insects that can hide in the folds of clothing
We absolutely mean to nit-pick, because we're talking about this small, flat bloodsucker that lives in human hair
The buzz is that the gallinipper is one of the largest types of this insect known for causing malaria
Deer & Rocky Mountain are types of these arachnids that draw blood through beak-like projections
The chicken & rat types of this arachnid, which may attack humans, are .1 inch long; in other words, small
On this series, Robin Wright isn't just the First Lady--she was also U.S. ambassador to the United Nations
This actor went from being Roseanne's TV hubby to senator Gil John Biggs on "Alpha House"
Joshua Malina plays the Attorney General on this show that's technically set in D.C. but c'mon, it's in Shondaland
This 1980s "Soap" spin-off had its main character go from running the governor's household to being lt. gov. himself
As Chief of Staff Teddy Sykes, Patton Oswalt was unafraid to give Jonah a hand on this comedy
To his troops this WWII general was "Dugout Doug" because he was rarely seen out of his tunnels in Corregidor
When banished to Elba, he told his people he'd return with the violets & he did, receiving the nickname "Corporal Violet"
German general Heinz Guderian was called the "Father of" this lightning war
This British field marshal was "Monty" & the "Spartan General", for his Spartan habits
He said his people called him the "Victor of Tampico" but Davy Crockett probably had a few other nicknames for him

Jesse Stone &
Spenser (for hire)
Philip Marlowe
Adam Dalgliesh
Jane Rizzoli
One favorite on the sweet aisle is the Y.S. Bee Farms brand of the clover type of this product
Kraft has big bags of these white things called Jet-Puffed that don't seem to weigh a lot
This product that comes in original, lite & sugar-free varieties shares a name with honest Abe's boyhood dwelling
C&H or Domino is a good choice for this colorful stuff containing oodles of molasses
Nutella is a spread made of these nuts with skim milk & cocoa
It's said Louisa, wife of J.Q. Adams, read the "Dialogues of Plato" to her sons in this language
Her extensive traveling during WWII earned her the code name "Rover"
"Lemonade Lucy", she was ruthless, not Rutherfordless, about not serving alcohol in the White House
Probably the "Bes"t First Lady athlete, she once shook 2483 hands in a single day
The $1 silver certificate issued in 1886 was 1st bill bearing a woman's portrait -- hers
You can visit Rossdhu, the historic home of the clan Colquhoun, on the bonny bank of this lake
In this state, once part of the French colony of Louisiana, you'll find Lincoln's tomb
Stops on this capital's Metro system's Linea Numero Uno include the Observatorio & the Aeropuerto
While Australia wants you to "Come & Say G'Day", Quebec is inviting people to "Come Say" this
Munich's Hofbrauhaus, Am Eisbach & Augustiner Keller have this type of garden
